humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the largest nodule of the invasive lobular carcinoma has a greatest dimension of 2.5 cm. Based on the rules provided, T3 tumors are more than 5 cm and T4 tumors are of any size with direct extension to the chest wall or skin. The report does not indicate direct extension to the chest wall or skin, and the largest tumor size is 2.5 cm, which falls within the T2 category (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). Therefore, the predicted T stage is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the size of the largest nodule of the tumor is given as 2.5 cm. Therefore, based on the T stage criteria for breast cancer, this patient's cancer would be classified as T2.
